Class PixelImage

java.lang.Object
  PixelImage

public class PixelImage
extends Object

PixelImage - Provides a picture as an array of Pixels

Version:
Oct. 31, 2007 !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS CLASS !!!
Author:
Richard Dunn, modified by Donald Chinn, modified by Parag, modified by Tammy VanDeGrift

Constructor Summary
PixelImage(BufferedImage bi)
          PixelImage maps a real image to a PixelImage object
 
Method Summary

          getData Return the image's pixel data as an array of Pixels.

          getHeight Returns the height of the image

          getImage Returns the buffered image

          getWidth Returns the width of the image

Constructor Detail

PixelImage

public PixelImage(BufferedImage bi)
PixelImage maps a real image to a PixelImage object

Parameters:
bi - The buffered image object used to create the PixelImageObject
Method Detail

getData

public Pixel[][] getData()
getData Return the image's pixel data as an array of Pixels. The first coordinate is the x-coordinate, so the size of the array is [width][height], where width and height are the dimensions of the array

Returns:
The array of pixels

getHeight

public int getHeight()
getHeight Returns the height of the image

Returns:
image height

getImage

public BufferedImage getImage()
getImage Returns the buffered image

Returns:
buffered image

getWidth

public int getWidth()
getWidth Returns the width of the image

Returns:
image width

setData

public void setData(Pixel[][] data)
             throws IllegalArgumentException
setData Sets the image's pixel data from an array. This array matches that returned by getData(). It is an error to pass in an array that does not match the image's dimensions or that has pixels with invalid values (not 0-255)

Parameters:
data - A 2-dimensional array of Pixels
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException
